intro: Lindleyella schiedeana, commonly known as the Schiede's lindleya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
